descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a pattern with a amount of space colored.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...becomes different with the different amount of colored in space, more information in the next step.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...I have to figure out how many colored in space I have and the grid becomes different because of that.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...black background with two grids of the same color and another two grid of a different color
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input grid size.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...copy the input grid, identify the colors of the colored grids. we will call it color A and color B. Around the grids with color A, create a 3x3 square with color B, surrounding the color A grids. Around the grids with color B, create a 3x3 square with color A, surrounding the color B grids. Now we should have four 3x3 squares, in which two squares are A color with B colored grid in their centers.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...two green squares and two green squares.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...copy the grid.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...two different color grid
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... same as input size
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...fill a grid with another color grid around a color grid.  connect the 3x3 square box by grey color and black color followed.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see... 4 dots, 2 blue, and 2 green diagonally from each other
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the same size
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...surround each dot using the opposite color on the input they should be 3x3 squares. Next, you connect the 3x3 squares with alternating grey and black dots, starting with grey touching the colored 3x3

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see... 4 dots, 2 blue, and 2 green diagonally from each other
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the same size
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...surround each dot using the opposite color on the input they should be 3x3 squares. Next, you connect the 3x3 squares with alternating grey and black dots, starting with grey touching the colored 3x3

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a 16by16 black background grid with two different colored grid in opposite and same color in diagonal
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same size as the input grid that is 16by16
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...copy the input grid then draw a 3by3 box around each colored grid with the opposite colored grid. Do this for all the colored grid. Then, link the boxes with a grey color line in between the spaces in the boxes you just made. If there are just two spaces (grids) do not any skip any of the grids in the black background color but if it is more than two, leave spaces in between the grey color line you are making. Make sure the grey color line starts and ends at edge of the boxes.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...black back ground with two grids of the same color and another two grids of a different color.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input grid
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...copy the input grid. Identify the colors of the colored grids, color A and B. Around the grids with color A, create a 3x3 square with color B, surrounding the color A grids. Around the grids with color B, create a 3x3 square with color A, surrounding the color B grids.  Now you should have four 3x3 squares, in which two squares are A color with B colored grid in their centers and two B colored squares with A colored grid in their centers. Next, you have to connect the squares with each other by creating grey grids and black grids alternately between each square, starting at the first column or first row right next to each squares sides middle grid

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see... black background with two grids of the same color and another two grids of a different color.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the same as the input grid size.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to... First, copy the input grid. Next, identify the colors of the colored grids - we will call it color A and color B. Around the grids with color A, create a 3x3 square with color B, surrounding the color A grids. Around the grids with color B, create a 3x3 square with color A, surrounding the color B grids. Now you should have four 3x3 squares, in which two squares are A color with B colored grid in their centers and two B colored squares with A colored grid in their centers. Next, you have to link the squares with each other by creating grey grids and black grids alternately between each square, starting at the first column or first row right next to each square's side's middle grid.
